title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.13-14 | 05-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshthaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadhadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 13th and 14th
verses of the Shri Advaitha Gadhadhara.
verses of the 11th chapter of the first canto of Shri Madbhagavatam.
The 13th verse
Gopura Dvaram Argeshu Krita Kautuka Toranam
Chitradhwaja Pataka Grair Antapratihata Tapam
The meaning of this verse is
the city gateway
the city gateway
the household doors and festooned arches along the roads
were all nicely decorated with festive signs
like plantain trees and mango leaves
all to welcome the Lord
flags, garlands and painted signs and slogans
all combined to shade the sunshine
you see
the
the
the
the
the
the
the whole city is prepared to welcome the Lord
the whole city is prepared to welcome the Lord
and how did they prepare?
they decorated the entire city
the gateway
the household doors
the arches along the road
everything was decorated very beautifully
with the natural nature's gift to the Lord and to the people of the world.
everything was decorated very beautifully with the natural nature's gift to the Lord and to the people of the world.
everything was decorated very beautifully with the natural nature's gift to the Lord and to the people of the world.
everything was decorated very beautifully with the natural nature's gift to the Lord and to the people of the world.
everything was decorated very beautifully with the natural nature's gift to the Lord and to the people of the world.
So, Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport, signs of decoration in special festivals were also collected from the gifts of nature such as the plantain trees, the mango trees, fruits and flowers.
Mango trees, coconut palms and plantain trees are still accepted as auspicious signs.
Whenever there is a need in the Vedic culture for decoration, they utilize such natural things.
They don't manufacture artificially some decorative items.
Such artificial decorative items are later on very difficult to dispose of.
Just like nowadays so much of hue and cry,
about plastic, the plastic waste is very difficult to dispose of.
Whereas all these natural products,
they are, as is said, biodegradable.
So, there is no difficulty in disposing them off.
And they are easily available without much endeavor on the part of the people to purchase them.
So, there is no difficulty in disposing them off.
So, there is no difficulty in disposing of these natural products.
This is the main thing I would suggest you to do…
… is suitable for your RFP somewhere …
Different
Yeah
the entrance of the temple the picture of Hanuman and Garuda are always painted
at the entrance even the deity of Hanuman Garuda are there in the
beginning of the temple so they are the great servitors of the Lord both render
valuable service to the Supreme Lord for devotees such paintings and decorations
are still adored and the servitor of the master is paid more respects for the
satisfaction of the Lord
Krishna says in Bhagavatam madbhakta puja abhyadika worship of my devotee is
greater than worship of me
Krishna says that in Bhagavatam eleventh canto while instructing Uddhava so
Hanuman and Garuda are great servants of the Supreme Lord so when they are paid
respects
by the devotees the Lord is thoroughly pleased by such respects paid to his dear
servants so the flags were decorated with paintings of Garuda or Hanuman so
in the Bhagavatam there is a description of different pastimes of the Lord with
Garuda participating in those pastimes when Krishna went with satya Bhamana
to the Indra loka to get one parijata tree that time he went on the back of
Garuda and when Krishna had to fight against Banasura then during 1 month he
similar to the time pressure on Lord Shiva to get the tree니다 then he went to
he was carried to that capital of Banasura by Garuda and Garuda also was
assisting the Lord in fighting against Banasura so in this way even Hanuman
Hanuman serves the Supreme Lord in his form as Ramachandra and Ramayana the
elaborate description is there how Hanuman served Lord Rama in so many ways
Hanuman is extraordinarily powerful but he uses all that power only for service
of Lord Rama not for any other purpose as opposed to that people in this world
due to some pious credits if they have got some power they want to utilize that
for their own good
for lauding over others or for their own sense gratification but the devotees
never utilize anything they may have or they may possess or they may acquire for
their own sense gratification they never use it for lauding over others because
the Supreme Lord is the Lord of everyone he is the Lord and everything should be
utilized for His service
because
everything belongs to him Isha vastyam idam sarvam yatkincha jagattyaham jagat
so therefore these two devotees servitors of the Supreme Lord are always
engaged in the service of the Lord and they are very powerful personalities it
is said Garuda when he's flapping his wings when carrying the Lord the hymns of
the Sama Veda emanate from the flapping of the wings of Garuda this is the
devotion of Garuda great personalities they have extraordinary power abilities
but everything is used simply for devotional service of the Supreme Lord
that's all that's the ideal
you
they teach us the ideal way of utilizing whatever we may possess the
14th verse samarjit mahamarga rathya apanaka chatwaram siktaam gandha jalair
uptaam phala pushpakshatam kuraihi the meaning of this verse is the highways
subways
lanes markets and public meeting places were all thoroughly cleansed and then
moistened with scented water see the opulence of Dwarka is to clean all the
roads thoroughly with water and then sprinkle scented water nice fragrance to
welcome the Lord fruits flowers and unbroken seeds were strewn everywhere and

This is also the opulence of the inhabitants of Dwaraka. So many fruits, so much flowers are there because the flower gardens are giving plenty of flowers and fruit orchards are supplying plenty of fruits.
So they can afford to strew them everywhere in order to welcome the Lord on the streets, in the junction places, road junctions and in the arches.
So Srila Prabhupada explains, scented waters prepared by distilling flowers like rose and khevra.
Were requisitioned to wet the roads, streets and lanes of Dwaraka Dham.
Again, scent is not artificially prepared by some chemicals but rather by distilling natural flowers which have got nice fragrance.
Such places along with the market place and public meeting places were thoroughly cleansed.
So clean.
So cleanliness is very prominent in Vedic civilization.
That means they are situated in the goodness, mode of goodness.
If not in the transcendental spiritual platform.
Of course Dwaraka Nivasis are on the transcendental platform.
But even those who are not on the transcendental platform, they should at least be in the mode of goodness.
That helps to develop the pious activities leading to ultimate development of bhakti.
From the above description it appears that the city of Dwaraka Dham was considerably big.
Containing many highways, streets and public meeting places with parks, gardens and reservoirs of water.
All very nicely decorated with flowers and fruits.
Nowadays we don't find so many parks or gardens in cities especially.
Because people have become very very greedy for constructing so many buildings.
The cities are more like concrete jungles.
Especially the most developed cities even in our country.
Formerly there used to be more gardens and parks and open spaces.
But now you don't find that.
To welcome the Lord such flowers and fruits with unbroken seeds of grain were strewn over the public places.
This is the opulence of the residence of Dwaraka.
Of course when Krishna Consciousness is there, there is plenty of supply of everything by material nature.
Because material nature is directed by the Supreme Lord.
Maya Dhyakshena Prakriti Hisu Yatesu Characharam
So the Lord will direct nature to supply everything when people are God conscious.
Krishna conscious.
When people become sinful then material nature withholds the production of grains and fruits and flowers.
And grains won't be sufficient like that.
Unbroken seeds of grain or fruits in the seedling stage were considered auspicious.
And they are still so used by the Hindus in general on festival days.
So this is the culture.
That decorations are done using natural supplies by nature.
Natural gifts like fruits, flowers, unbroken seeds, water pots with yogurt and grains like that.
So Dwaraka.
So Dwaraka where Krishna resided with all the Vrishnis, his relatives and friends and his family members was the ideal city.
And everyone there was devoted to Krishna.
Were devotees of Krishna.
That is the ideal for human civilization.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
